column1: Risk factors for gastroparesis include: - Diabetes - Gastrectomy (surgery to remove part of the stomach) - Systemic sclerosis - Use of medicine that blocks certain nerve signals (anticholinergic medicine)
Ongoing nausea and vomiting may cause: - Dehydration - Electrolyte imbalances - Malnutrition People with diabetes may have serious complications from poor blood sugar control.
